abstract: A Boolean value that indicates whether to extend the configuration to subdomains of the given domain.
overview:
## Discussion

You can include this key in any of the domain-specific dictionaries that you add to the [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSAppTransportSecurity/NSExceptionDomains] and [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSAppTransportSecurity/NSPinnedDomains] dictionaries. Adding the [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSIncludesSubdomains] key affects the applicability of the other configuration in the same domain-specific dictionary. The key is optional, with a default value of `NO`.

Set the value for this key to `YES` to apply the configuration for the given domain to all subdomains of the domain that have one additional path component. For example, if you set this value to `YES` and the domain name string is `example.com`, then the configuration applies to `example.com`, as well as `math.example.com` and `history.example.com`. However, it doesn’t apply to the subdomains `advanced.math.example.com` or `ancient.history.example.com` because those subdomains have two additional path components. If the value is `NO` the configuration applies only to `example.com`.

If you create an [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSAppTransportSecurity/NSExceptionDomains] dictionary for an IP address or a range of addresses, the [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSIncludesSubdomains] key has no effect for that exception.

# NSIncludesSubdomains

**Property List Key**

A Boolean value that indicates whether to extend the configuration to subdomains of the given domain.

## Discussion

You can include this key in any of the domain-specific dictionaries that you add to the [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSAppTransportSecurity/NSExceptionDomains] and [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSAppTransportSecurity/NSPinnedDomains] dictionaries. Adding the [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSIncludesSubdomains] key affects the applicability of the other configuration in the same domain-specific dictionary. The key is optional, with a default value of `NO`.

Set the value for this key to `YES` to apply the configuration for the given domain to all subdomains of the domain that have one additional path component. For example, if you set this value to `YES` and the domain name string is `example.com`, then the configuration applies to `example.com`, as well as `math.example.com` and `history.example.com`. However, it doesn’t apply to the subdomains `advanced.math.example.com` or `ancient.history.example.com` because those subdomains have two additional path components. If the value is `NO` the configuration applies only to `example.com`.

If you create an [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSAppTransportSecurity/NSExceptionDomains] dictionary for an IP address or a range of addresses, the [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSIncludesSubdomains] key has no effect for that exception.

## Related Documentation

- **NSExceptionDomains**: Custom App Transport Security (ATS) configurations for named domains.
- **NSPinnedDomains**: A collection of certificates that App Transport Security expects when connecting to named domains.
